article_content:
## HR.1

The One Big Beautiful Bill Act, passed as Public Law No. 119-21 on July 4, 2025, reduces taxes and alters spending for various federal programs. It also increases the statutory debt limit. [https://www.congress.gov/bill/119th-congress/house-bill/1](https://www.congress.gov/bill/119th-congress/house-bill/1)


**Committees**

This bill is in the House Budget Committee. [https://www.congress.gov/committee/house-budget-committee/hsbu00](https://www.congress.gov/committee/house-budget-committee/hsbu00)


**Sponsor**

Rep. Arrington, Jodey C. is the sponsor of the bill.  [https://www.congress.gov/member/rep-arrington-jodey-c/A000375](https://www.congress.gov/member/rep-arrington-jodey-c/A000375)


**Cosponsors & overlap**

There are currently no cosponsors listed for this bill.  The provided text does not contain information about whether any of the cosponsors are members of the committee that the bill is in.


**Hearings**

No hearings have been held on the bill.  [https://www.congress.gov/](https://www.congress.gov/)


**Amendments**

There have been 493 amendments proposed to the bill.  Senators Padilla, Alex [D-CA] proposed amendments SAMDT 2851 and SAMDT 2850. Senator Klobuchar, Amy [D-MN] proposed amendment SAMDT 2849 to strike a provision relating to delayed implementation of the supplemental nutrition assistance program matching funds requirements. Senator Graham, Lindsey [R-SC] proposed amendment SAMDT 2848 to improve the bill.  Senator Warner, Mark R. [D-VA] proposed amendment SAMDT 2847 to use revenues from lease payments from Metropolitan Washington Airports for aviation safety improvements and other purposes.


**Votes**

The bill passed the House with a party-line vote.  [House Roll Call 190](https://www.congress.gov/bill/118th-congress/house-bill/3) shows that the vote was 218 to 2, with Republicans voting in favor and Democrats voting against.

## HR.5371

The Continuing Appropriations and Extensions Act, 2026 provides continuing FY2026 appropriations for federal agencies [link to bill]. The bill also includes additional funding for security for federal officials.  It is currently in the process of being considered by the Senate.


**Committees**

This bill is in the House Appropriations Committee and the House Budget Committee. [https://www.congress.gov/committee/house-appropriations-committee/hsap00](https://www.congress.gov/committee/house-appropriations-committee/hsap00) [https://www.congress.gov/committee/house-budget-committee/hsbu00](https://www.congress.gov/committee/house-budget-committee/hsbu00)


**Sponsor**

Rep. Cole, Tom is the sponsor of the bill. [https://www.congress.gov/member/rep-cole-tom/C001053](https://www.congress.gov/member/rep-cole-tom/C001053)


**Cosponsors & overlap**

There are currently no cosponsors listed for the bill.  The provided text does not contain information about whether any of the cosponsors are members of the committee that the bill is in.


**Hearings**

No hearings have been held on the bill. [https://www.congress.gov/](https://www.congress.gov/)


**Amendments**

No amendments have been proposed to the bill.


**Votes**

The Senate voted on the motion to proceed to H.R. 5371 with a vote of 54-45. [Record Vote Number: 590](https://www.congress.gov/vote/?id=590).  A party-line vote occurred as no detailed party breakdown was available for the Senate vote.

## HR.5401

The Pay Our Troops Act of 2026 would provide continuing appropriations for military pay during periods when interim or full-year appropriations for Fiscal Year 2026 are not in effect, such as during a government shutdown.  The bill is currently referred to the House Committee on Appropriations. [https://www.congress.gov/bill/119th-congress/house-bill/5401](https://www.congress.gov/bill/119th-congress/house-bill/5401)


**Committees**

This bill is in the House Appropriations Committee. [https://www.congress.gov/committee/house-appropriations-committee/hsap00](https://www.congress.gov/committee/house-appropriations-committee/hsap00)


**Sponsor**

Rep. Kiggans, Jennifer A. is the sponsor of the bill. [https://www.congress.gov/member/rep-kiggans-jennifer-a/K000399](https://www.congress.gov/member/rep-kiggans-jennifer-a/K000399)


**Cosponsors & overlap**

Rep. Fitzpatrick, Brian K., Rep. Mace, Nancy, and Rep. Kean, Thomas H. are among the top cosponsors of the bill.  [https://www.congress.gov/member/rep-fitzpatrick-brian-k/F000466](https://www.congress.gov/member/rep-fitzpatrick-brian-k/F000466), [https://www.congress.gov/member/rep-mace-nancy/M000194](https://www.congress.gov/member/rep-mace-nancy/M000194) , and [https://www.congress.gov/member/rep-kean-thomas-h/K000398](https://www.congress.gov/member/rep-kean-thomas-h/K000398) are all members of the House Committee on Energy and Commerce.


**Hearings**

No hearings have been held on the bill. [https://www.congress.gov/](https://www.congress.gov/)


**Amendments**

No amendments have been proposed to the bill.


**Votes**

No votes have been held on the bill.

bill_title: National Defense Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 2026
article_content:
## S.2296

The National Defense Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 2026 (S. 2296) sets forth policies and authorities for the Department of Defense's programs and activities, military construction, and national defense in FY2026.  It was passed by the Senate on October 9, 2025, with a vote of 77-20. [https://www.congress.gov/bill/119th-congress/senate-bill/2296](https://www.congress.gov/bill/119th-congress/senate-bill/2296)


**Committees**

This bill is in the House Armed Services Committee. [https://www.congress.gov/committee/house-armed-services-committee/ssas00](https://www.congress.gov/committee/house-armed-services-committee/ssas00)


**Sponsor**

Sen. Wicker, Roger F. [R-MS] is the sponsor.  [https://www.congress.gov/member/sen-wicker-roger-f/W000437](https://www.congress.gov/member/sen-wicker-roger-f/W000437)


**Cosponsors & overlap**

There are currently no cosponsors listed for this bill.  The provided text does not contain information about which committee the bill is in, or whether any of the cosponsors serve on that committee.


**Hearings**

No hearings have been held on the bill.  [Link to relevant page if one exists]


**Amendments**

Eight hundred eighty-four amendments were proposed on the bill.  Amendments SAMDT 3928 and 3927 were proposed by Senators Gallego and Merkley respectively, requiring the Secretary of Defense to establish a pilot program for deploying microreactors and limiting the use of Federal law enforcement officers for crowd control, and for other purposes. [link] Amendment SAMDT 3926 was proposed by Senator Cornyn and aimed at protecting national security by imposing sanctions on certain Chinese individuals and prohibiting anâ€¦  [link]


**Votes**

The bill passed the Senate on October 9, 2025, with a vote of 77 to 20.  [Record Vote Number: 570](https://www.congress.gov/vote/570)

bill_title: A bill to designate the facility of the United States Postal Service located at 154 First Avenue East in Jerome, Idaho, as the "Representative Maxine Bell Post Office".
article_content:
## S.24

This bill, titled "A bill to designate the facility of the United States Postal Service located at 154 First Avenue East in Jerome, Idaho, as the 'Representative Maxine Bell Post Office'", seeks to officially rename the U.S. Postal Service facility at that address as the "Representative Maxine Bell Post Office".  The bill is currently in the Committee on Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs stage of the legislative process. [https://www.congress.gov/bill/119th-congress/senate-bill/24](https://www.congress.gov/bill/119th-congress/senate-bill/24)


**Committees**

This bill is in the House Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs Committee. [https://www.congress.gov/committee/house-homeland-security-and-governmental-affairs-committee/ssga00](https://www.congress.gov/committee/house-homeland-security-and-governmental-affairs-committee/ssga00)


**Sponsor**

Sen. Crapo, Mike is the sponsor of the provided information.  [https://www.congress.gov/member/sen-crapo-mike/C000880](https://www.congress.gov/member/sen-crapo-mike/C000880)


**Cosponsors & overlap**

One senator cosponsored the bill, Sen. Risch, James E. [R-ID] (R).  [https://www.congress.gov/member/sen-risch-james-e/R000584](https://www.congress.gov/member/sen-risch-james-e/R000584)


**Hearings**

No hearings have been held on the bill. [https://www.congress.gov/](https://www.congress.gov/)


**Amendments**

No amendments have been proposed to the bill.  There are no related links.


**Votes**

No votes have been held on the bill.

bill_title: Continuing Appropriations and Extensions and Other Matters Act, 2026
article_content:
## S.2882

The Continuing Appropriations and Extensions and Other Matters Act, 2026 provides continuing FY2026 appropriations for federal agencies.  It also permanently extends the expanded premium tax credit for purchasing health insurance. The bill is currently in the process of being debated in the Senate. [https://www.congress.gov/bill/119th-congress/senate-bill/2882](https://www.congress.gov/bill/119th-congress/senate-bill/2882)


**Committees**

Please provide the bill text or information about the bill so I can determine which committees it is assigned to.


**Sponsor**

Sen. Murray, Patty is the sponsor of the provided information. [https://www.congress.gov/member/sen-murray-patty/M001111](https://www.congress.gov/member/sen-murray-patty/M001111)


**Cosponsors & overlap**

There are currently no cosponsors listed for this bill.  The provided text does not contain information about which members of Congress serve on the committee that the bill is in.


**Hearings**

No hearings have been held on the bill. [https://www.congress.gov/](https://www.congress.gov/)


**Amendments**

No amendments have been proposed to the bill.  There are no related links available.


**Votes**

The Senate voted on the bill, with a final vote of 47 to 50. [Record Vote Number: 557](https://www.congress.gov/vote/557).  A detailed party breakdown was not available for the vote.

## S.499

The Government Shutdown Prevention Act of 2025 provides continuing appropriations to prevent a government shutdown if an appropriations bill for a fiscal year has not been enacted before the fiscal year begins. The bill is currently in the process of being reviewed by the Committee on Appropriations. [https://www.congress.gov/bill/119th-congress/senate-bill/499](https://www.congress.gov/bill/119th-congress/senate-bill/499)


**Committees**

This bill is in the House Appropriations Committee. [https://www.congress.gov/committee/house-appropriations-committee/ssap00](https://www.congress.gov/committee/house-appropriations-committee/ssap00)


**Sponsor**

Sen. Paul, Rand [R-KY] is the sponsor of the provided information.  [https://www.congress.gov/member/sen-paul-rand/P000603](https://www.congress.gov/member/sen-paul-rand/P000603)


**Cosponsors & overlap**

The provided text states there are no cosponsors for the bill.  There is also no information about whether any of the cosponsors are members of the committee that the bill is in.


**Hearings**

No hearings have been held on the bill. [https://www.congress.gov/](https://www.congress.gov/)


**Amendments**

No amendments have been proposed to the bill.


**Votes**

No votes have been held on the bill.

bill_title: An executive resolution authorizing the en bloc consideration in Executive Session of certain nominations on the Executive Calendar.
article_content:
## SRES.412

This bill, titled "An executive resolution authorizing the en bloc consideration in Executive Session of certain nominations on the Executive Calendar," was agreed to by the Senate without amendment by a 51-46 vote on October 3, 2025.  [https://www.congress.gov/bill/119th-congress/senate-resolution/412](https://www.congress.gov/bill/119th-congress/senate-resolution/412)


**Committees**

Please provide the bill text or information about the bill so I can determine which committees it is assigned to.


**Sponsor**

Sen. Thune, John is the sponsor of the information provided. [https://www.congress.gov/member/sen-thune-john/T000250](https://www.congress.gov/member/sen-thune-john/T000250)


**Cosponsors & overlap**

There are currently no cosponsors listed for this bill.  The provided text does not contain information about whether any cosponsors are members of the committee that the bill is in.


**Hearings**

No hearings have been held on the bill.  [link to search results]


**Amendments**

Two amendments have been proposed on the bill.  Amendment SAMDT 3919 was proposed by Senator Thune, John [R-SD], and Amendment SAMDT 3918 was also proposed by Senator Thune, John [R-SD]. The purposes of both amendments are not available.


**Votes**

The bill was passed by the Senate with a vote of 51-46. [Record Vote Number: 541](https://www.congress.gov/vote/541).  While the vote was bipartisan, no detailed party breakdown is available.

bill_title: Impeaching Donald John Trump, President of the United States, for high crimes and misdemeanors.
article_content:
## HRES.353

This resolution, titled "Impeaching Donald John Trump, President of the United States, for high crimes and misdemeanors," seeks to impeach President Donald Trump based on seven articles of impeachment. The bill is currently in the NOTIFICATION OF INTENT TO OFFER RESOLUTION stage, meaning Mr. Thanedar has notified the House of his intent to offer the resolution. [https://www.congress.gov/bill/119th-congress/house-resolution/353](https://www.congress.gov/bill/119th-congress/house-resolution/353)


**Committees**

This bill is in the House Judiciary Committee. [https://www.congress.gov/committee/house-judiciary-committee/hsju00](https://www.congress.gov/committee/house-judiciary-committee/hsju00)


**Sponsor**

Rep. Thanedar, Shri is the sponsor of the bill. [https://www.congress.gov/member/rep-thanedar-shri/T000488](https://www.congress.gov/member/rep-thanedar-shri/T000488)


**Cosponsors & overlap**

Rep. Mfume, Kweisi [D-MD-7], Rep. Nadler, Jerrold [D-NY-12], and Rep. Kelly, Robin L. [D-IL-2] are cosponsors of the bill.  Rep. Mfume, Kweisi [D-MD-7], is a member of the House Judiciary Committee.  [https://www.congress.gov/member/rep-mfume-kweisi/M000687](https://www.congress.gov/member/rep-mfume-kweisi/M000687)


**Hearings**

No hearings have been held on the bill.  [Link to relevant page if applicable]


**Amendments**

No amendments have been proposed to the bill.


**Votes**

No votes have been held on the bill.

bill_title: Full-Year Continuing Appropriations and Extensions Act, 2025
article_content:
## HR.1968

The Full-Year Continuing Appropriations and Extensions Act, 2025 provides continuing FY2025 appropriations for federal agencies and extends various expiring programs and authorities. The bill was enacted on March 15, 2025 (link: [https://www.congress.gov/bill/119th-congress/house-bill/1968](https://www.congress.gov/bill/119th-congress/house-bill/1968)).


**Committees**

This bill is in the House Appropriations Committee and the House Budget Committee.  [https://www.congress.gov/committee/house-appropriations-committee/hsap00](https://www.congress.gov/committee/house-appropriations-committee/hsap00) [https://www.congress.gov/committee/house-budget-committee/hsbu00](https://www.congress.gov/committee/house-budget-committee/hsbu00)


**Sponsor**

Rep. Cole, Tom is the sponsor of the bill. [https://www.congress.gov/member/rep-cole-tom/C001053](https://www.congress.gov/member/rep-cole-tom/C001053)


**Cosponsors & overlap**

There are currently no cosponsors listed for this bill.  The provided text does not contain information about whether any of the cosponsors are members of the committee that the bill is in.


**Hearings**

No hearings have been held on the bill.  [Link to relevant information]


**Amendments**

There have been 23 amendments proposed to the bill.  Sen. Ernst, Joni [R-IA] proposed Amendment SAMDT 1288, but the purpose is not available.  Amendments SAMDT 1287 and 1285 were proposed by Sen. Booker, Cory A. [D-NJ], and Sen. Coons, Christopher A. [D-DE], respectively, but their purposes are also unavailable.


**Votes**

The bill passed the Senate by a vote of 54 to 46.  [Record Vote Number: 133](https://www.congress.gov/vote/133).  A party-line vote occurred as no detailed party breakdown was available for the Senate votes.
